conversation.text: I recommend watching "Mansfield Park" (1814). The movie is set in the 17th century and follows the life of Fanny, a young woman born into poverty. When Fanny's wealthy uncle Sir Thomas decides to adopt her, she must navigate a complex web of family dynamics, social climbing, and personal sacrifice. "Mansfield Park" is a classic drama that explores themes such as power, family, and identity. The movie features a talented cast, including Julia Smith, who plays the role of Fanny Mansfield. Overall, "Mansfield Park" is an excellent drama that is definitely worth watching.

- Title: Alex in Wonderland (N/AA) | Plot: Bohemian Alex Morrison has just finished directing his first feature-length movie. In its previews, the movie is considered a critical, artistic, and surefire commercial success, so Alex seemingly has his choice of what his next project will be. Alex has a few ideas, like a biopic of Lenny Bruce or a movie about a black uprising in Los Angeles. As he makes the rounds of both the Hollywood community and European movie centers for ideas, he fantasizes about movie scenarios of his everyday situations, influenced by his movie idols, some of whom he actually meets, like Italian director Federico Fellini and French actress Jeanne Moreau.
- Title: Passion (2011) | Plot:  Passion is the story of Jack Passion, a man who has defied social convention and become an ambassador for the sport of competitive beard growing. Through good times and bad, he has pushed on to become the two time world beard champion. He shares this inspirational story with us and guides us through his world in a 6 minute narrative doc. He considers what his world has become due to his beard and contemplates the thought of a world without.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "Delirium" as a suitable option.

"The Delirium," released in 2011, is an action-packed thriller that tells the story of Emily, who after mysteriously disappearing for over a year, returns home to her mother and stepfather. Emily, however, is not the same person she was before she disappeared.

As Emily begins to experience strange changes in her body, Emily finds herself fighting to stay alive against all odds.

"The Delirium" tells an intense and gripping story that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. The film's cast includes several well-known actors such as Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Nicholas Turturro, etc., who bring their own unique talents and skills to the table, resulting in a truly exceptional cinematic experience.
I hope this recommendation helps and that you enjoy watching "The Delirium"."
